data.title: VS Code does not recognize javascript anymore after update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 (0.10.11) f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Ever since VS Code updated and restarted, no files or projects have intellisense nor does it have peek definition, go to definition, etc. It cannot find references to symbols either.

I've tried the insider release and the 10.10 as well. This just started happening within the last week and I have been using Code since release in 2015.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any project (including new express app in the node example page)
2. Nothing works and VS Code does not resolve any references.

I've added jsconfig.json as well and restarted, but it did not make any difference.

data.title: ⇧⌘E is focusing `working files` and not `explorer`
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file from `working files` (⌘K + E; ↓↑; Enter) or by clicking
2. Now press ⇧⌘E, it should focus the `explorer`, but focuses the `working files`

Note: If the last opened file is from `explorer` or by typing the filename (⌘P), successive ⇧⌘E focuses `explorer`

data.title: Travis build failing

It looks like it was introduced in this [build](https://travis-ci.org/Microsoft/vscode/builds/122335204) and [this commit](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/37f5e2b3552e62a708395c396bcc364fa844b64f).

data.title: Go back/forward should not consider points every 5 lines when navigating with keyboard

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Put the cursor somewhere in the middle of the file
2. Hold down arrow key for a while
3. Perform the Goto > Back action several times

It should be smarted what points in the page are recorded. It would be more useful if only events of significance should add new points:
- Starting to type in a new area
- Finding a definition
- Clicking
- etc.

data.title: Application behaving weirdly and keep adding multiple files with the same name and showing up ESLint error.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

I am trying to debug .js file with node debugger. After couple of execution, I observed that application is adding multiple version of the app.js (I can see in the command pallete there are 3 app.js listed as below).
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14478481/fcae5402-00ca-11e6-9bf1-3c62e8e6f738.png)

When I open chrome developer tool to identify issue I could see so many errors listed related to app.js
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14478528/7983a8d8-00cb-11e6-8d3a-915ab56ff0de.png)

Find below ESLint error screenshot: I am not certain from where this file (app.js) is referred by eslint as the file I am referring in my project is updated properly and there is no error on it. I verified it manually as well and the changes I made in my first execution was already reverted (LN 7: aasadasds update as ss dd dd  sd)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14478768/833f0870-00cd-11e6-9b07-3937a85a7603.png)

PFA error log for more details:
[ErrorLog.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/216142/ErrorLog.zip)

Note: I am able to debug my code without any problem. I observed this weird behavior when I saw a eslint error in the status bar.

data.title: Changing language mode keeps previous linter and shows non-errors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an HTML file
2. Change language mode to Javascript
3. Change back to HTML

Actual:
Showing many errors as it still thinks it is in Javascript language mode.
![languagemodeswap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14478166/f4df4824-00c7-11e6-9767-cac15b71d644.JPG)

data.title: Feature request: Provide more diagnostics information for source mapping
data.body:
We've seen several users run into issues while trying to use a Debugger in VS Code with source mapping for JavaScript projects (From TypeScript, React-Native, etc...). It's not trivial to configure your build project to generate the correct source maps, and it's difficult to understand if, and when they are wrong.

I'd be amazing if you could add better diagnostic tools so it'd be easier for the users to debug these kind of issues. For example, you could add a new feature that when you put a breakpoint on TypeScript, if you hover over it you'll see a tooltip that shows you a snippet from the mapped JavaScript code, and where was the breakpoint put exactly on the JavaScript code. You could also have a "More info" button on that tooltip, that would decode the values that are included in the source map, and show you exactly how the source map says the characters around the breakpoint should be mapped to the source code.

We've also noticed that sometimes if you put breakpoints and the source map is not completely valid, the breakpoints might disappear completely, or appear at the end of the file. It'd be nice if you could also have more validations around this (for example check that the breakpoint line should be less than the total lines of the file where you are putting that breakpoint), and show a nice error message with diagnostic information when something doesn't appear to be right, instead of just "ignoring" that breakpoint or error silently.

For more information you can see an issue that was created against our extension: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-react-native/issues/206#issuecomment-209109389

data.title: Not able to perform folding action on <HTML> tag.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any html file. 
2. Verify formatting and perform folding by pressing "CTRL+SWIFT+["  or with mouse hover action.

Actual: Except for <HTML> tag folding is working for all other tags.
Expected: Folding should work for all the html tags.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14476719/5df14344-00be-11e6-83a2-cfb8baa3c28b.png)

data.title: Launch.json program path intellisense suggestions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create or open the launch.json file
2. Modify the Program path

Actual:
No intellisense suggesting a path.

Expected:
It would be great if it showed you the folder/file options after typing a forward slash '/'. I would expect it to work similarly to File Explorer.

data.title: [folding] Odd behavior typing next to a folded section
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Collapse a section
2. Navigate to the left of the ellipsis 
3. Start typing

![foldbehavior](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14473335/6461a7bc-00ac-11e6-8953-8f5112e94383.gif)

It would make sense if the folded section expanded if you start typing next it.

data.title: Normalize all file paths in the workbench
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

I observed, when I did setup for typescript project to debug my code and provided app.js file path in the launch.json with all lowercase then I could see explorer is showing up two file version and considering them local vs disk version.
1. Path provided in launch.json : "program": "${workspaceRoot}/scripts/app.js",
2. Actual path on the disk: ....\Scripts\app.js

So the only difference between these two paths is the folder name "Script" (uppercase) and "script" (lowercase).

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14472146/9e45d2d8-00a6-11e6-8446-4035534bffa8.png)

Actual:
1. User is keep getting the error for version mismatch when performing edit and save operation.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14472520/5ceb5d88-00a8-11e6-9f44-b6445f1cdfd9.png)
1. After resolving the mismatch issue using compare tool it is still considering two different file version and managing them separately.

![comparetoolissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14472616/d10f72e4-00a8-11e6-8644-93501f312def.gif)
Expected: Path under launch.json should be case neutral and application should not make two file version.

data.title: Regex search does not work with \n or \r
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Win 7 , SP 1

Steps to Reproduce:
Assume you have a document with the following lines: 
// 1
// 2
// 3
1. Open search window (ctrl+f) and activate search with regex ( alt+R) 
2. type in search box : //\s1
   Expected Result : One match 
3. add \n or \r to the end of search regex (now search regex will be : //\s1(\n|\r)
   Bug: No Result!!

data.title: When user launch the Compare tool then it should not be part of multi-screen window.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When user has multiple instances of the same file (in my case app.js) and perform save operation on them separately then sometime user gets an error message like below and when user clicks on compare button then the compare tool is opening in the new screen (for app.js).
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14470604/4a3b2fdc-009f-11e6-89c9-9bb50a37ff32.png)

Expected: 
1. It should close or hide all the multi-screen window which are associated with the same file (in  my case app.js). In the below screen shot there is no point to keep app.js window active when we are performing compare operation on the same file.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14470305/903e6e1a-009d-11e6-9d06-cfc986ea07a5.png)
2. When user performing compare operation they need enough view area to compare file contents so it would be good if we can open only compare window when user click on compare button.

data.title: Multi instance of the file should preserve the break points.
data.body:
In my dev environment I observer that there are two instances of the app.js (same path reference) opened and the only difference is in break points. 

Expected:
We should keep the break point reference across all the instances so that there will be no confusion.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14469329/fa21e172-0098-11e6-9566-e34dbaccef29.png)

File path:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14469432/61695f5e-0099-11e6-8583-2022c28be2dd.png)

data.title: Linux: Snippets (C#)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
  Version 0.10.15-insider
  Commit 67567498285c2081312077cc24370d97676fc20a
  Date 2016-04-11T10:51:25.123Z
  Shell 0.35.6
  Renderer 45.0.2454.85
  Node 4.1.1
- OS Version:
  Ubuntu x64 15.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. type prop
2. Press CTRL+SPACE

Nothing occurs.
I also added a prop snippet just in case it wasn't present but based on the documentation it should have all the standard ones in there.

csharp.json:

```
    "property": {
        "prefix": "prop",
        "body": [
            "private prop ${type} $2{name};",
            "prop ${type} $2{name}(${type} value)",
            "{",
                "get",
                    "{",
                        "value = ${name};",
                    "}",
                "set",
                    "{",
                        "${name} = value;",
                "}",
            "}"],
            "description": "Basic property"
    }
}
```

data.title: Allow for refactoring (renaming) across multiple Typescript projects
data.body:
I have a folder that contains a Typescript Client and Typescript Node Server subfolder. There is a third top level directory, common, where we store our isomorphic Typescript code.

In order for a rename to work across files a tsconfig.json file is needed that includes the top module of your project and all submodules must be imported properly.

When attempting to perform a rename of a class defined in the common folder the action is only applied to one of the two typescript projects. Adding a top level tsconfig.json that points to the starting modules of both projects did not change this behavior.

Ideally, a refactor would follow all tsconfig.json module trees as needed.

data.title: The functions in JavaScript are not displayed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10 pro
  
  In HTML document the functions in JavaScript are not displayed when using operator "." inside of `<script> </script>` label. For example, in version 0.10.6 I can use:

`<script>`
        `var myVar = document.(all functions appear listed here);`
`</script>`

However, in the current version, the functions are not shown. I have tried to install extensions to try to mitigate it, but the problem persists.

Any of you have the same problem?

Update:

When working in HTML within the `<script>` tag functions do not appear, but. if the language is changed to JavaScript on the bottom right, the functions appear correctly, but marks syntax errors throughout the document, the solution to this is to set the language HTML and restart VS Code.

data.title: Tab character not treated as whitespace when deleting

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.15-insider
- OS Version: Tested on Fedora Linux 23 and Windows 10
1. `<cursor><space><space>{`
   When pressing `Ctrl+Delete` in this situation only the spaces get deleted.
2. `<cursor><tab>{`
    In this situation also the { character gets deleted, but it should behave exactly the same as in the first case.

```
 at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:89:15) 
```

data.title: Find all references on a Typescript class constructor returns no results.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.15-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create class and constructor.
2. Create a new instance of the newly created class
3. Shift + f12 or right click find all references

I would expect it to find all references of the class being constructed "new ExampleClass()".

data.title: Supported .ru extension and Guardfile
data.body: [.ru extention](https://github.com/rack/rack) and [Guardfile](https://github.com/guard/guard) are frequently used in the Ruby on Rails.

data.title: Open containing folder of open file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any file in VS Code

In the context menu of an open file there should be an option to open the containing folder.

Alternatively the "Open folder" button could open in the containing folder of the currently opened file.

data.title: Output and debug windows are hidding when user try to adjust window height.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and perform build or debug operation to get output or debug window.
2. Try to adjust height of the window and verify application behavior.
3. Compare the same behavior in visual studio.

Actual: Output/debug window is completely hidden.
Expected: Window title should be visible when user try to adjust minimum height.
![outputwindowpositionissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14453818/f09c637c-004b-11e6-817e-a60397248512.gif)

Visual Studio:

![outputwindowposition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14453942/9c80c0ac-004c-11e6-9ff3-a604c00302f3.png)
